awd_titl_txt: Conference: Fall 2023 Mathematics Conference: Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems and Applications
awd_abstract_narration:
On September 29-30, 2023, the Department of Mathematics of Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, will hold a conference on Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems and their Applications. In conjunction with the conference there will be a meeting devoted to research presentations by undergraduate students celebrating the Ohio Delta Chapter of Pi Mu Epsilon National Honorary Mathematics Society. The main goals of the conference are to inspire the new generation of mathematicians by exposing students to cutting-edge research in the area of Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems, foster collaborations between participants between researchers in the Tri-State region (Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana), and encourage involvement of underrepresented minorities in mathematical research on this topic. The 2023 Mathematics Conference will have an additional goal of reviving in-person interactions and rebuilding the community negatively impacted by the recent pandemic. 

A broad range of topics will be presented in invited talks by Janet Best (The Ohio State University), Todd Kapitula (Calvin University), and Milena Stanislavova (The University of Alabama at Birmingham). Participants will present their research results in a series of parallel talks. Sessions devoted to student presentations are planned. Students will be addressed by Stephanie Edwards (Hope College), the President of Pi Mu Epsilon National Honorary Mathematics Society. The conference will serve as a platform for social interactions between students and junior researchers with senior mathematicians through a sequence of organized events. Conference information is available on the following website: https://miamioh.edu/cas/academics/departments/mathematics/about/events/annual-mathematics-conference/index.html

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
On September 29-30, 2023, the Department of Mathematics at Miami University, Oxford, Ohio, hosted a conference focused on Differential Equations, Dynamical Systems, and their Applications. This event brought together a diverse group of mathematicians, fostering engagement with advanced topics and promoting interdisciplinary collaboration. In conjunction with the main conference, a special session celebrated the Ohio Delta Chapter of the Pi Mu Epsilon National Honorary Mathematics Society, featuring research presentations by undergraduate students.

The primary goals of the conference were threefold: to inspire the next generation of mathematicians by introducing students to cutting-edge research, to foster collaboration among researchers from the Tri-State region (Ohio, Kentucky, and Indiana), and to encourage the participation of underrepresented minorities in mathematical research. Additionally, the 2023 conference aimed to revive in-person interactions and strengthen the mathematical community following the challenges imposed by the recent pandemic.

The conference saw high attendance with 142 participants, including 100 students and 42 faculty members, Ph.D. students, and professionals. A total of 22 participants were supported by the National Science Foundation (NSF), including 13 undergraduate and Ph.D. students, enabling them to attend and actively participate in the conference.

The conference featured invited talks by distinguished speakers, including Dr. Janet Best (The Ohio State University), Dr. Todd Kapitula (Calvin University), and Dr. Milena Stanislavova (The University of Alabama at Birmingham), who addressed a broad range of topics related to differential equations and dynamical systems. Parallel sessions allowed participants to present their own research findings, creating a dynamic exchange of ideas and insights.

The event also included a special address by Dr. Stephanie Edwards (Hope College), the President of Pi Mu Epsilon, who spoke directly to students, emphasizing the value of undergraduate research in mathematics. The conference prioritized social interaction between students, junior researchers, and established mathematicians through organized networking events, encouraging mentorship and collaboration.

Overall, the 2023 Mathematics Conference at Miami University served as a successful platform for academic exchange, community building, and inspiration for future mathematicians.


Last Modified: 11/12/2024
Modified by: Alim Sukhtayev
